alert.note: Alert for Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Pennington Co Plains; Southern Meade Co Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued May 19 at 11:01PM MDT until May 21 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TO 6 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. * WHERE...Harding County, the Pennington County Plains, the Southern Meade County Plains, Butte County and the Northern Meade County Plains. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 8 AM to 6 PM MDT Friday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Sudden wind gusts can cause drivers to lose control, especially in lightweight or high profile vehicles. Strong winds can cause blowing dust, reduced visibility, and flying debris. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Butte; Harding; Northern Meade Co Plains; Pennington Co Plains; Southern Meade Co Plains
